Article Image

Search Tables or Procs

Post #5

Blog Logo

Jason McBride

on 26 Aug 2015
Tags: sql featured
read

Often I find myself working on large databases accross multiple projects and I start forgetting where certain things are. After having this occur multiple times I decided to look into searching the database for a keyword to see which tables or stored procedures that item may exist in. There are many resources for this on using T-SQL, my two favorite links are: [SQL SERVER – 2005 – Search Stored Procedure Code – Search Stored Procedure Text]http://blog.sqlauthority.com/2007/09/03/sql-server-2005-search-stored-procedure-code-search-stored-procedure-text/ and [SQL SERVER – Query to Find Column From All Tables of Database]http://blog.sqlauthority.com/2008/08/06/sql-server-query-to-find-column-from-all-tables-of-database/

After copying and pasting these over and over whenever I needed I finally decided to merge the two into a stored procedure for easier reuse.

 1 CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[spS_UTIL_SEARCH_TABLES_AND_PROCS]
 2  @phrase VARCHAR(150)
 3 AS
 4 BEGIN
 5 
 6 /*****************************************************************************************************************
 7  * File: spS_UTIL_SEARCH_TABLES_AND_PROCS
 8  * Author: Jason McBride
 9  * Version 1.0
10  *
11  * This proc takes a parameter and searches all tables and
12  * stored procedures and returns the results
13  *
14  * HISTORY
15  *
16  * Initial version 1.0
17  * August 14, 2015
18  *
19  *****************************************************************************************************************/
20  
21 -- search tables
22 SELECT t.name AS table_name,
23 SCHEMA_NAME(schema_id) AS schema_name,
24 c.name AS column_name
25 FROM sys.tables AS t
26 INNER JOIN sys.columns c ON t.OBJECT_ID = c.OBJECT_ID
27 WHERE c.name LIKE '%' + @phrase +'%'
28 ORDER BY schema_name, table_name;
29 
30 -- search procs
31 SELECT Name
32 FROM sys.procedures
33 WHERE OBJECT_DEFINITION(OBJECT_ID) LIKE '%' + @phrase + '%'
34 RETURN;
35 END

The only caveat is that you need to add this proc to any database in which you wish to run the search.
